title: Birth rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
There is a difference of 3.3 between the maximum Month Trentino-South Tyrol and minimum Month Sardinia.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Birth rate per thousand inhabitants for 20 number of Months.
Month Trentino-South Tyrol has the highest Birth rate per thousand inhabitants and Sardinia has the lowest Birth rate per thousand inhabitants.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.

max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in the y axis.
The maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants 9.0 is found at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and the minimum is found at Sardinia where Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is 5.7.
Second maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is found at Month .
The highest Month Trentino-South Tyrol has 3.3 more Birth rate per thousand inhabitants than the lowest Month Sardinia.
The Month Trentino-South Tyrol has the highest Birth rate per thousand inhabitants, followed by , and Sicily. Down to the Month Sardinia which is the lowest.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants has reduced over the past 20 Months.
Similar Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is found in Month Lazio, Apulia, Aosta Valley, and Veneto.
The highest value 9.0 at Trentino-South Tyrol is almost 1.28 times larger than the average value 7.05.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 141.0.
